summary: The term "boarding school" refers to an educational institution where students reside during the academic term, receiving both instruction and accommodation. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, boarding schools are subject to various directives concerning educational standards, child welfare, and residential care. These institutions must comply with regulations that ensure the safety, well-being, and rights of minors, aligning with EU policies on education and youth protection. Furthermore, boarding schools may be involved in cross-border educational initiatives, necessitating adherence to EU regulations on mobility and recognition of qualifications, thereby promoting a cohesive educational environment across member states.
